SEARCH
Module com.gang60
Package com.gang60

Class MenuCatalog

java.lang.Object
com.gang60.MenuCatalog
public final class MenuCatalog extends Object
Provides a global, observable catalog of menu items used throughout the POS system. The catalog acts as an in-memory cache for all menu entries retrieved from or synchronized with the database.

Typical use cases:

  • Storing menu items loaded from the database.
  • Providing shared menu data to multiple UI controllers.
  • Updating or removing items when edits are made in MenuEditorController.

  • Method Details

    • options

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<MenuCatalog.MenuOption> options()
      Returns the observable list of all menu options currently loaded.

      The returned ObservableList is automatically tracked by JavaFX, allowing UI components (e.g., TableView) to automatically refresh when the list changes.

      Returns:
      the observable list of menu options

    • setAll

      public static void setAll(Collection<MenuCatalog.MenuOption> opts)
      Replaces the entire catalog with the provided collection of menu options. Any previous entries in the list are cleared.
      Parameters:
      opts - a Collection of MenuCatalog.MenuOption objects to load into the catalog

    • setAll

      public static void setAll(Iterable<MenuCatalog.MenuOption> opts)
      Replaces the entire catalog with the provided iterable set of menu options.

      This overload supports flexible data sources that implement Iterable.

      Parameters:
      opts - an Iterable of MenuCatalog.MenuOption objects

    • addOrUpdate

      public static void addOrUpdate(MenuCatalog.MenuOption opt)
      Adds a new MenuCatalog.MenuOption to the catalog, or updates an existing one if a matching ID already exists.
      Parameters:
      opt - the MenuCatalog.MenuOption to add or update

    • removeById

      public static void removeById(int id)
      Removes a menu option from the catalog by its unique ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the menu item to remove
